# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

This function splits the text into words and appends each word to a line. If the length of the line with a new word exceeds the specified `text_width`, it starts a new line. The function then returns all the lines joined by a newline character.
